author: ronald
msg: - Use unix-io instead of stdio to read /dev/random (fixes problems
- Correctly unescape all parts of the request uri and the uri
attribute of the Authorization header before doing comparison
- Don't send a domain attribute in Proxy-Authenticate

author: lars
msg: This should point to Brian Harvard's OS/2 pages.

author: bjh
msg: Configuration files are text files so open them in text mode.
Some OS/2 (and probably DOS & Windows) text editors like to put Ctrl-Z EOF
markers at the end of the files they edit. Opening the config files in text
mode prevents the Ctrl-Z from causing 'Invalid command' errors when starting.
